TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit RequestClaim extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Represents a single requested claim in a security token request (RST).

remarks.format:
## Remarks Represents a single claim inside a wst:Claims element in a wst:RequestSecurityToken message. The entire contents of the wst:Claims element is represented by a <xref:System.IdentityModel.Protocols.WSTrust.RequestClaimCollection> which is a collection of <xref:System.IdentityModel.Protocols.WSTrust.RequestClaim> objects. The contents of the wst:Claims element is accessed through the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Protocols.WSTrust.RequestSecurityToken.Claims%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property.
A <xref:System.IdentityModel.Protocols.WSTrust.RequestClaim> object represents a request for a claim, identified by its claim type (the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Protocols.WSTrust.RequestClaim.ClaimType%2A> property), to be present in the security token issued by the STS. The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Protocols.WSTrust.RequestClaim.IsOptional%2A> property indicates whether the claim is required in the in the issued token.
For more information about the element that this class represents, see the version of the WS-Trust specification that applies to your scenario.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(string claimType) cil managed

Docs.param: The URI that represents the claim type.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified claim type.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Protocols.WSTrust.RequestClaim.IsOptional%2A> property is set to `false` and the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Protocols.WSTrust.RequestClaim.Value%2A> property is set to `null` in the new <xref:System.IdentityModel.Protocols.WSTrust.RequestClaim> instance. This constructor creates a <xref:System.IdentityModel.Protocols.WSTrust.RequestClaim> object that represents a request for a claim that is required in the response.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Protocols.WSTrust.RequestClaim.Value%2A> property is set to `null` in the new <xref:System.IdentityModel.Protocols.WSTrust.RequestClaim> instance.
